intro: Sidastrum tehuacanum, commonly known as the Tehuacán morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
